org.jetel.graph

Interface IGraphElement

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DBConnection, IConnection, LookupTable, Sequence
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDBConnection, AbstractJobflowComponent, AbstractNoSQLConnection, Aggregate, AggregateOld, AproxMergeJoin, BulkLoader, CheckForeignKey, CloverDataReader, CloverDataWriter, Concatenate, DataGenerator, DataIntersection, DataReader, DataRecordMetadata, DataWriter, DB2DataWriter, DBConnectionImpl, DBExecute, DBFDataReader, DBFDataWriter, DBInputTable, DBJoin, DBLookupTable, DBOutputTable, Dedup, DelimitedDataReader, DelimitedDataWriter, Denormalizer, Dictionary, Edge, ExtDataGenerator, ExtFilter, ExtSort, ExtXmlWriter, Filter, FixLenDataReader, FixLenDataWriter, GraphElement, HadoopConnection, HadoopReader, HadoopWriter, HashJoin, HttpConnector, InfobrightDataWriter, InformixDataWriter, JavaExecute, JmsConnection, JmsReader, JmsWriter, JobflowEdge, JsonExtract, KeyGenerator, LdapReader, LdapWriter, LookupJoin, LookupTableReaderWriter, Merge, MergeJoin, MsSqlDataWriter, MysqlDataWriter, Node, Normalizer, OracleDataWriter, Partition, Phase, PostgreSqlDataWriter, PrimitiveSequence, RangeLookupTable, Reformat, Rollup, RunGraph, SequenceChecker, SimpleCopy, SimpleDataGenerator, SimpleGather, SimpleLookupTable, SimpleSequence, Sort, SortWithinGroups, SpeedLimiter, StructureWriter, SystemExecute, TextTableWriter, TransformationGraph, Trash, TreeReader, TreeWriter, XLSReader, XLSWriter, XMLExtract, XmlReader, XmlWriter, XmlXPathReader, XSLDataTransformer

    public interface IGraphElement
    This interface should be implemented by all elements living in a transformation graph - - components - connections - lookup tables - sequences - metadata - ...

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String XML_ID_ATTRIBUTE
      Name of required XML attribute for element identifier.
      static java.lang.String XML_NAME_ATTRIBUTE
      Name of required XML attribute for element name.
      static java.lang.String XML_TYPE_ATTRIBUTE
      Name of required XML attribute for element type.

    • Method Detail

      • checkConfig

        ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.

      • init

        void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Initialization of the graph element. This initialization is done exactly once at the start of the existence of this graph element. All resources which are intended to remain allocated during the whole time of the graph existence (including time between each graph run), should be allocated in this method. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the free() method.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • preExecute

        void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the postExecute() method.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • postExecute

        void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        This is de-initialization method for a single graph run. All resources allocated in preExecute() method should be released here. It is guaranteed that this method is invoked after graph finish at the latest. For some graph elements, for instance components, is this method called immediately after phase finish.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • commit

        void commit()
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with success - Result.FINISHED_OK. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if all graph processing was completely successful. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.

      • rollback

        void rollback()
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with error or was aborted - Result.ERROR, Result.ABORTED. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if some part of graph failed. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.

      • reset

        @Deprecated
void reset()
           throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Deprecated. this method was substituted by pair of another methods preExecute() and postExecute(). This method should be invoked automatically by preExecute() method for backward compatibility. Restore all internal element settings to the initial state. Cannot be called before init() and after free() method invocation.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • free

        void free()
        This is de-initialization method for this graph element. All resources allocated in init() method should be released here. This method is invoked only once at the end of this graph element existence.

      • getGraph

        TransformationGraph getGraph()
        Returns:
        transformation graph which this graph element belongs

      • setGraph

        void setGraph(TransformationGraph graph)
        Sets parent transformation graph.
        Parameters:
        graph -

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Returns:
        unique string identifier

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        human readable graph element name

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - human readable graph element name

      • isChecked

        boolean isChecked()
        Returns:
        true if graph element is checked by checkConfig method; else false

      • isInitialized

        boolean isInitialized()
        Returns:
        true if graph element is initialized by init() method; else false

      • firstRun

        boolean firstRun()
        Returns:
        true if the graph element is in first iteration of life cycle

      • getRuntimeJobType

        JobType getRuntimeJobType()
        Returns runtime job type for current graph - JobType.ETL_GRAPH, JobType.JOBFLOW or JobType.SUBGRAPH. The transformation graph can be driven in slightly different way in case jobflow run for example.

      • getLog

        org.apache.log4j.Logger getLog()
        Returns:
        dedicated logger for this graph element

      • getPropertyRefResolver

        PropertyRefResolver getPropertyRefResolver()
        This methods is easy way how to get valid property reference resolver, which can be used to resolve graph parameters (${x}), special characters (\n) and in-line CTL code (`today()`) in a given string.
        Returns:
        property reference resolver populated with parameters of parent graph

      • getDescriptor

        GraphElementDescription getDescriptor()
        Returns:
        element type descriptor

      • setDescriptor

        void setDescriptor(GraphElementDescription descriptor)
        Sets element type descriptor.
        Parameters:
        description - descriptor for type of this element
